data.event: Riverside was founded in March 1886 when the Riverside Land Company, led by developer James Oakley Davidson, had the area surveyed and platted.
The local real estate market collapsed the next year, however, and development stalled for a decade.
The local real estate market collapsed the next year, however, and development stalled for a decade.

event.title: 1889, several of the company's investors, including Davidson and Burton Campbell, had built

data.event: By 1889, several of the company's investors, including Davidson and Burton Campbell, had built large, luxurious homes for themselves.
In 1897, the Wichita city government purchased land in the neighborhood and began developing parks.

event.title: followed by a zoo in Central Riverside Park in 1921

data.event: The Riverside Boathouse opened on the Little Arkansas River in the late 1890s followed by a zoo in Central Riverside Park in 1921 and a public swimming pool in South Riverside Park in 1923.
The Wichita Art Museum opened in 1935.
In 1938, the Works Progress Administration replaced the pool with a second pool called Municipal Beach.
